column4: anyone know why thunderbird says its running, when its really not?

cos it is running, open a terminal and type "top" then press the letter "u" then type your username - you can then type "k" and kill your instances of thunderbird by putting in the numbers on the left hand side of the screen
its not in there
mozilla-thunder
it is not in there at all
type q to leave top
type killall thunderbird
'no process killed'
then it is not running

when I type thunderbird into the console or try to run it from the desktop.. it says thunderbird is running but not responding, please kill thunderbird or reboot your system.. I've rebooted, but it still says the same thing
do this ps auwx > foo and paste that output into http://paste.ubuntu.com and gove me the url
hold, pasting

give me a moment please
np, take your time

'Thunderbird is already running, but not responding. To open a new window, you must first close the exsisting thunderbird process, or restart your system
